description: Principled contextual understanding evaluation using SQuAD benchmark question
reference: Rajpurkar, P., et al. (2016). SQuAD: 100,000+ Questions for Machine Comprehension of Text. EMNLP 2016

conversations.context: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It was constructed from 1887 to 1889 as the centerpiece of the 1889 World's Fair. The tower is 324 meters tall, about the same height as an 81-story building, and the tallest structure in Paris. Its base is square, measuring 125 meters on each side. During its construction, the Eiffel Tower surpassed the Washington Monument to become the tallest man-made structure in the world, a title it held for 41 years until the Chrysler Building in New York City was finished in 1930.
conversations.question: What was the original purpose of the Eiffel Tower?
conversations.explanation: The passage states it was constructed as the centerpiece of the 1889 World's Fair
